name: Fruit of the Loom
reviews: I usually order a pack of these every 6 months or so to use as undershirts, workout shirts, or just lounge-around-at-home shirts. They're quite comfortable, good quality and fit me very well. That is until this latest pack - it seems that the fabric quality or thickness has been reduced as this last pack is too lightweight. So lightweight that the shirts are verging on 'sheer' and you can see through them while dry, let along when you add a hint of sweat. Im not confident that this latest batch will even last for the next 6 months which is a shame. I'll see how it goes and report back.

name: Fruit of the Loom
reviews: I love Fruit of the Loom 100% cotton white T-shirts. I have probably bought more than a hundred of them for the last 15 years, mainly as work undershirts. Also, at home, there‚Äôs nothing like wearing a 100% cotton, soft and comfy shirt for all seasons. I usually buy these from Walmart, so it's my first time buying Fruit of the Loom T-shirts  from Amazon. It‚Äôs also my first time buying in multi-color.Yes, I have read the reviews advising me to buy one size up, especially because of shrinkage after laundry. I was so stubborn I did not listen. I ordered my usual medium size, only to realize I indeed should have listened to the previous reviewers. I ended up returning the medium size and buying one size up for me ‚Äì the large size.Anyway, I am so happy that out of the 6 large T-shirts delivered, five of them are 100% cotton. The heather gray is 90% cotton and 10% polyester, but it still feels like almost 100% cotton, so I can‚Äôt complain. These are so comfortable and perfect for all seasons (paired with a sweater, of course, during winter).Prompt delivery, no damage or defects, soft and comfortable, value for money, and environmentally friendly packaging ‚Äì I would definitely buy again. It is five stars for sure.

name: Fruit of the Loom
reviews: The Fruit of the Loom Men's Eversoft Cotton Crew T-Shirt is a comfortable and reliable choice for everyday wear. The cotton fabric feels soft against the skin and is breathable, making it suitable for various activities.One of the standout features of this T-shirt is its design, which includes a crew neck and a stay-in-place fit. I've found that the neckline retains its shape wash after wash, and the overall fit is true to size.The T-shirt is versatile and can be worn on its own or layered under other clothing. The classic design makes it easy to pair with different outfits, whether for casual or more dressed-up occasions.I appreciate the durability of this T-shirt, as it has held up well through multiple washes without losing its shape or color. The fabric also maintains its softness, even after repeated laundering.

name: Fruit of the Loom
reviews: Purchased the 6 pack for alternative night wear for my son. The quality of fabric for the affordable price has me and him smiling . Previously purchased t shirts on Amazon did not come as nice and machine safe ! Shirts did not shrink after washing like most of the other t shirt brands available ! I will be buying more as he grows ! Shipping was fast and cameBefore expected !

name: Fruit of the Loom
reviews: I‚Äôve searched everywhere for these and finally found them! Couldn‚Äôt be happier!!

name: Fruit of the Loom
reviews: This review is for a 6-pack of Fruit of the Loom, White Medium T-Shirts. I've been buying/wearing this brand of T-Shirts for as long as I can remember. These are high quality (very soft 100% cotton), exceptionally comfortable T-Shirts, which fit me well and have a generous length (so no pulling out from my pants). Fabric is smooth to the touch, and not at all itchy. The fabric and stitching appear heavy duty and it looks like these T-Shirts should last several years. After several cycles of wearing, washing & drying, I've not noticed any shrinkage, creasing, discoloration, unraveling or tearing. At Amazon's price, these were a best value and a very good deal. I'm very satisfied with my purchase!

The price is also right compared to the many other options on Amazon. If you are looking for a cheap, comfortable undershirt, these are the ones. :)

name: Hanes Men's Short Sleeve Beefy T (Pack of 2)
reviews: Even unwrapping these t-shirts I knew they were going to be big. Upon donning them I was right, they are huge. In fact I bought another brand at the same time also in XXL and laying one on top of the other showed a significant difference in size. The Hanes Beefy shirts are at least 3XL using other makes as a guide. It's not a huge issue, I wear tees in winter for layering, but they're so big they look daggy at the neck, the only part that shows. Made in Haiti so it's gratifying to see manufacturing in poor countries adjacent to the US. They are thick as advertised, but in the absence of significant shrinkage I'd go a size down, hoping of course that the size difference is consistent across the Hanes Beefy range (i.e. one size too big). The image shown has Aquagard T-shirts in XXL on top of the Hanes in XXL and the difference is significant- and the yellow shirts were larger than other XXL tees I've purchased recently.

reviews: I ordered  2 different colours in XL - red and blue.  They arrived seperately and the red was manufactured in Ethiopia while the blue was manufactured in Haiti. I have been wearing and washing both colours for a few months and find that the red has way too big a neck opening  compared to the blue and hence does not feel as good a fit around the neck and shoulder area making me not want to wear the red at all.I am very happy with the quality of the fabric and really like the Haynes beefy T's , but I am now wary of ordering some more as I dont know which colour/manufacturer combinations are which.You should expect consistent quality between the manufacturing locations.

name: Hanes Men's Short Sleeve Beefy T (Pack of 2)
reviews: My husband was frustrated with other brands of T-Shirts being too thin and thus, not very attractive to wear out and about.  I suggested he try a Hanes Beefy-T, so he got a white one and loves it so much, I've purchased several in different colors for his Christmas gift.  As well made and long-wearing as these are, he should be set for quite some time.  Beefy-Ts are, without a doubt, the absolute best T-Shirts you can buy, and you definitely won't regret the purchase.  These are all cotton, so if you're vacillating about which size to buy, go with the larger one just to be sure it'll stiff fit beautifully after going through the washer and dryer.

name: Hanes Men's Short Sleeve Beefy T (Pack of 2)
reviews: I seldom wear t-shirts for anything other than walking the dog and sleeping in.  I dislike the seams, tags and stretching that after a short while distorts the fit and thus the look of the shirt.  The heavy Beefy-T has none of the aforementioned issues.  It's extremely well made with just the right weight fabric to resist stretching AND tagless.  The fabric wears like iron to the point where the neckline of my favorite Beffy-T sleep shirt wore through after 8 years use before requiring replacement.  If you're buying expensive T-shirts from American  Apparel of the like you are wasting large sums of money.

name: Hanes Men's Short Sleeve Beefy T (Pack of 2)
reviews: I bought these for my husband months ago and they are still in great shape. He works for a tree company and his clothes generally get ripped, stained, and ruined after just a few weeks (and many times, days!)These two shirts are worn at least once or twice per week, while working, and are in the same shape as when I bought them. There are no holes or rips anywhere on the shirts and they are just as strong as when I received them. Stains are impossible to avoid, but the shirt couldn't be of better quality and durability even months after purchasing them.The color and description are the same as pictured and described by the seller.This is a great deal on two high quality Men's short sleeved t-shirts, and I would definitively recommend them!I bought these shirts at full price. When I'm very satisfied with a purchase, I like to give a review and hopefully help or answer some questions potential buyers may have.

name: Lucky Brand
reviews: These shirts are a great alternative to men's T-shirts. They are stylish and come in many colors (I own about 12 different colors). The ONLY thing to know about them is that they wear out quickly (like 2 seasons). I wear mine a lot (7 months out of the year they are my main t-shirt), so they get washed a lot and quickly take on the faded (burn-out) look. It's a nice look up to a point, and then the shirts just look threadbare. But at $20-35 per shirt (depending on when I buy them) they are still a great deal if they last only 2 years. The fabrics vary from color to color, even though you'd think they are all made of the same stuff. For instance, the "white" color clearly has more cotton in the blend and will last longer. Some colors, seemingly randomly, last longer than others. But again, they ALL look great when new and I get compliments on them all the time. Several of my male friends have pretty much abandoned their old t-shirts in favor of a collection of the Venice Burn-out shirts. I sure I'll be buying more of them!

name: Lucky Brand
reviews: The cut of these shirts makes it look like I bought them on purpose, for the fit. Which I did. I bought one, loved the way it fit, and went back to buy 4 more in different colors. Great purchase.I'm 6'1, 215 with what clothing companies would call an "Athletic build," Meaning I'm a big guy with broad shoulders, but not significantly overweight (maybe 10 pounds over, which for my body type isn't very much.) Most T-shirts for around $20 don't fit me very well. XL is usually too big, hanging like curtains below my shoulders. And L is generally right on the edge for me. If I'm 10 pounds over my normal, as I am right now (and likely will be for the foreseeable future), a size Large will be too tight across my chest.The wrong fit can really make me look bad by adding perceived weight, while the right fit usually brings a lot of "Hey, did you lose weight?" questions.These shirts, in an XL are perfect for me. Big enough to fit my shoulders, tapering a little bit in across my 'not bad' torso.  Well worth the extra money. Love them.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 26 October 2023

name: Lucky Brand
reviews: I‚Äôll start with the cons. After a few washes, the shirts pile up. (Tiny little cotton balls that pile up everywhere on the shirt) the colors do indeed fade, but who cares, it still looks good. I hardly ever gotten compliments on shirts but I did with these shirts but I didn‚Äôt get the shirts for that reason. They are very comfortable and have a great fit. Especially if you‚Äôre in the slightly athletic and up, build. Nice fit on the biceps. But not too tight, nice fit around the chest. It even accentuates your back quite well too. Look, they shirts are 20 bucks. Buy a couple colors you like, if you like them a lot, but one or two more of that same color and put them away for when they stop selling these shirts. They are worth the cons that everyone talks about.To make them last longer and keep their size. Never dry them using any heat, not even the delicate setting. I hang dry all of mine. I think air fluff dryer setting would work fine. Machine wash gentle. Even as they fade or ‚Äúpile‚Äù up, they are still a much better looking shirt than any logo or solid color tee. Buy one! You‚Äôll love it.True to size. Good length. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô4‚Äù 210, about a 40cm bicep. Sleeves are slightly snug on my arms for a nice look.

name: Gildan Men's Crew T-Shirts, Multipack, Style G1100, Black/Sport Grey/Military Green (5-Pack)
reviews: These Gildan Men's Crew T-Shirts are on the thin side, so if you're expecting a heavyweight t-shirt, you're going to be disappointed.  These are all cotton, which I prefer, and are very soft and comfortable.  When washed and dried, they end up a wrinkly mess, so don't expect them to look like the ones pictured, except when you first take them from the package.  Speaking of which, why do they have to use the world's stickiest tape to stick to each rolled up shirt in the package?  You should take care in peeling this sticky tape from the shirt so you don't raise the nap and create a "stripe" where the tape was attached.  I guess the price is fairly reasonable, as what I paid came to about $4.40 per shirt.  Recommended.

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: When I saw the price and the review of this Merino Protect shirt, I had to try it!  I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort and quality of Merino Protect's shirts. I now have 3 of them.  I'm a big fan of 100% merino wool - I commute by bicycle in NYC, and I prefer to wear 100% merino in all seasons.  Many other manufacturers have taken to blending their merino with man-made fibers, which detracts from the quality and experince.  This short sleeve model does a great job - the material is really soft and wicks sweat wonderfully. The length is perfect; it's a bit longer than a typical cotton T-shirt, which makes it just right for cycling.  I'm 5'8", 170lb, and the medium fits me beautifully - stays close to my skin for wicking, without being too snug.I wanted to wait until I washed them a few times before writing this review, and I can tell you my Merino Protect shirts are holding up great and are as soft as new.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 9 December 2023

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: Very good company to deal with ‚Ä¶. great customer relations!Have not had products long enough to comment on longevity or wear, but quality looks great!

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: Ich hatte bei Einem anderen Hersteller mehrere Merino, T-Shirts und lange Unterhosen bestellt. Leider haben sich diese beim an und ausziehen, extrem statisch aufgeladen, so dass mir, was im Sinne des Wortes die Haare zu Berge standen. Ganz anders bei diesem Produkt. Es ist gut verarbeitet f√ºhlt sich gut an und entspricht voll meinen Erwartungen ob es im Gebrauch auch so gut ist, werde ich in einer sp√§teren Rezession schreiben. Jetzt geht es jedenfalls erst mal drei Monate mit auf die Reise.Der Beitrag im Internet, das Merino wolle sich zwangsl√§ufig statisch aufl√§dt, weil sie aus mehreren Lagen besteht und das sogar noch mehr als Kunstfaser ist definitiv falsch.

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: I bought this T-Shirt for my husband for our trip overseas.  His assortment of current shirts was sad and nothing that dried quick and kept him dry.  This Merino T-Shirt was perfect.  He is an X-L and it fit him perfect.  He looked great and he said was very comfortable.  We had use of a washer while in Sicily so he washed his shirts and let them dry on the rack.  At first it had a funny smell and I thought it was the washer sheets I had bought for the trip and was thinking I needed to rewash.  But by the time the shirts dried, all smell was gone and they were great.  They dried very quickly even on a shaded balcony.  This shirt takes up basically no room in the suitcase and since we did carry on only - this was very important.  Great product!!  Highly recommend.

reviews: One of the softest merino t-shirts I‚Äôve worn. Extremely comfortable, nicely shaped and well manufactured. A premium merino fabric that‚Äôs not got a hint of scratchiness or itchiness to it. Worn for travel as it genuinely does regulate temperature in both cold and warm conditions, and you can very easily wear it for two or three days without needing to be washed. I also use it as a daily base layer under casual shirts and hoodies. Washes fine on a short, cold machine wash on the ‚Äòwool‚Äô setting and dries quickly. Wonderful, versatile, good value.

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: The T-shirt exceeded my expectations. This is my first experience with merino wool, and I absolutely love it. You just leave it hanging for a couple of hours and you're ready to go again.

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: I don't know many people who want to or can afford to pay $50-60+ for a T-shirt that is likely going to be an under shirt but such is the price of merino wool.  I have several merino wool long sleeve base layer shirts that I love for outdoors activities in winter (costing $80-120) but wanted short sleeve merino wool shirts for warmer weather and specifically for travel as they are light, soft & comfortable and don't hold body odor.  But check the prices of several top name brands.  So for $34 I took a chance and this is a solid shirt.  Merino wool T-shirts are not meant to be 'heavy'.  And 100% merino is not that strong and often is blended w polyester for strength.  So some care is required.  I purchased an XL, which is a bit tight.  There is some mild shrinkage if you don't wash in cold water and if you put it in a dryer, low heat for just a few minutes then lay flat to finish.  I liked the shirt so much I purchased 2 more in XXL and they are perfect at this price point.  Packaging was on point and no tears, holes or design flaws in the shirts.  I have washed these a couple of times now and they are wearing great.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 9 March 2023

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: I've been a long-time fan of Merino wool clothing, especially when it comes to using them as winter base layers and for cool-weather travel. My experience with Merino wool has always been positive in terms of its benefits and comfort. Recently, I decided to expand my travel wardrobe and purchased the Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirt, as well as a slightly less expensive option from MERINNOVATION.Though I haven't had the opportunity to put these shirts to the test during my travels yet, I couldn't resist trying them out during scorching 100-degree weather. The results were impressive! Among the Merino Wool Protect, MERINNOVATION, and regular cotton t-shirts, the Merino Wool Protect shirt stood out. Its design seemed to prioritize ventilation, allowing me to feel surprisingly cool despite the intense heat. In contrast, the MERINNOVATION shirt felt notably hotter than even the regular cotton tee, which was quite unexpected.I can't help but wonder if the variance in merino wool blends between these two shirts contributed to the significant difference in comfort levels. Regardless, the Merino Wool Protect shirt unquestionably emerged as the winner in this comparison. The superior cooling effect it provided was a game-changer, making it an obvious choice for my upcoming travels.Unfortunately, the MERINNOVATION shirt didn't live up to expectations and was promptly returned. It's clear to me that the Merino Wool Protect shirt is the real deal, offering both the benefits of merino wool and a thoughtfully engineered design for ventilation.While I'm eagerly awaiting the chance to put these shirts through their paces during actual travel scenarios, my initial experience with the Merino Wool Protect shirt leaves me optimistic and impressed. Its cooling performance and comfortable fit have already won me over. I can't wait to see how it performs on my next adventure!Pros:Impressive cooling performance even in extreme heatComfortable fit and designClear distinction from less effective alternatives like MERINNOVATIONCons:Limited testing opportunity so farOverall, highly recommended for anyone seeking quality merino wool clothing that truly delivers on comfort and cooling capabilities!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 29 August 2023

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: Good merino wool t-shirts like this are worth every penny. Beware of cheap ones that say "merino wool" and are actually spandex with a percentage of Merino that needs more than one digit of accuracy to show up.This was a well-made t-shirt at a very competitive price-point, that feels like wool. It's slightly scratchy to the touch compared to cotton, yet not "rough". You could not be faulted for thinking it's going to be itchy when you first feel it with your hands. But once it's on your body, it feels great: it regulates temperature beautifully without ever feeling suffocating, and coddles you unobtrusively. It stretches a surprising amount. And surprisingly for the weight, it does not collect body odor, and dries quite quickly when you wash it.As I mentioned in the title, I guffawed at the price, but once I tried it, I went back and bought some more, and since I bought them, I have worn no other t-shirts. I have thrown on a cotton t-shirt now & again, but every time, the entire time I'm wearing cotton I'm wondering "why am I not wearing the nice t-shirts?"Update: a few months later, after these were not available for a while, I was so happy to see them back that decided to go all-in and buy 4 more. Sadly, their sizing and the thickness of the material have changed and not for the better.I will give them credit for feeling OK otherwise, but the L that fit perfectly before now feels thinner and sort of sloppy, esp. around the neck. Basically, they must be subcontracting the actual manufacturer, and the new maker went looser on the pattern. Not at all happy to have spent over $200 on 4 t-shirts that are lower quality, and not what I bought before, and they really *should* have announced in bold that the fit is completely different now, but still for someone in the 210/5'10 to 250-6'3 range the L should be a good fit now.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 September 2021

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: Free returns, I guessed that it wouldn‚Äôt hurt to look at these, but at their price I thought they were probably cheaply made. Well, I was wrong! I like them, and they seemed to be of just as good quality and fairly similar thickness of other high quality merino wool t-shirts. I am big on merino wool person, and having trekked over 12,000 miles in the last six years, always wear merino wool as a base layer and top layer. I also use merino wool clothing for everyday wear. I have many of the top brands, Meriwool, Merino.tech, Minus33, Woolly, Smartwool, Burton, and my favorite, Icebreaker. I have found over the years that most of clothing from the brand names companies are of fairly similar overall good quality, and now Merino Protect will be up there with merino wool clothing I‚Äôll buy.The material definitely is wool, and if you‚Äôve worn merino before, you‚Äôd notice that right away and not mistake it for any other material. The collar is not overly loose like many cheap t-shirts, and the stitching appears well made. I am 6‚Äô1‚Äù and was concerned with some of the reviews that noted it was short. I ordered x-large and it fits me well as I am about 195 lbs. If you are bigger, you might be out of luck. For me, before it was washed, it hung well below my belt, and almost to my crotch, plenty long for me. However, the sleeves seemed fairly short, but that is the style with most t-shirts, and I just like them long like the old traditional t-shirts.I have read several reviewers state that they thought this material was thin, and even cheap. To me it seems that these might be around 160-170 gm of merino wool, fairly standard for light to mid weight wool t-shirts. They are definitely not thin! Compared to cotton for sure, but if you‚Äôve never worn merino wool as an all around t-shirt, you might not know that this thickness and feel is typical of all merino wool t-shirts.I bought three black and one camo, and I am surprised and very pleased with the quality, and plan to buy several more for this price! I bought a lot of Merino.tech t-shirts when they first came out because they were price below everyone else because they were new. Now they are up there in price with all the other merino wool t-shirts, and maybe that‚Äôs why these are so very reasonably priced for a very good quality merino wool t-shirt. I‚Äôd say, get these at this price while you can.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 20 May 2021

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: I bought two small Merio Wool shirt from this company.  I wore them alternating days.  In Mexico November is pretty cold in the day and hot in the middle of the day.  It kept me warm in the morning when it was cold and in the afternoon walking all over the city the weather was warm and even hot.  I did sweat during the day and came back to the hotel without a smell.  I hang the shirt up in the closet and use the other one the next day.  Went hiking to the Pyramid in Mexico with a hot weather.  Sweat like crazy and came back to the hotel at night and shirt did not smell.  I did wash the shirt once due to some food spill.  My vacation was 15 days.  When I finally got back home, I wash them properly with mild soap and let it hand dried.  Seal it in a plastic bag to avoid moth from eating your shirt.  Will buy more in the future for future trip.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 13 December 2023

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: Having never experienced desert conditions, prior to a recent trip attending a wedding in Saudi Arabia I researched t-shirts that scored highest with respect to keeping cool. This compelled me to perform an experiment by purchasing two different highest-scoring wool t-shirt brands (because wool as a cooling solution simply seemed counterintuitive to me).  Here‚Äôs my review for this Merino Protect base layer t-shirt.First, and foremost, I‚Äôll start at the end and point out this shirt was not only the lower-priced of the two, the other shirt‚Äôs price skyrocketed from $47 at the time of the purchase to now (only a month later) $74 while (at the time of this review) this Merino Protect shirt is still available at $38 and is a best deal in my humble opinion. And that leads to point number 2:Yes, cotton and polyester t-shirts are easily available at half the price or less. However, I could never have worn a cotton or polyester t-shirt after walking around in Saudi Arabian afternoon sun without an odorous finish. Amazingly, this wasn‚Äôt this case for either of these two wool shirts purchased and tested on this wedding trip. In fact, that afternoon walk was the day after having worn this shirt as my base layer during the entire 20 travel hours of driving, flight, and layover time. Even my wife exclaimed surprise at how the shirt remained nearly odorless at the end of the second day in the Saudi sun.Benefit #3 is how well this shirt keeps its shape. After hand washing both and placing both on hangers to dry, the other higher-priced shirt ended up with a stretched shoulder on one side. This Merino Protect held up just fine. Lesson learned, BTW, as I now lay these flat to dry (hangers not recommended).My only complaint has much to do with why my wife calls me ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù when eating. Something liquidy landed on this shirt (gray color) and though I initially drenched the dime-sized spot with water and then a couple of hours later hand washed the shirt with extra emphasis on the stain spot, an echo of the spot remains. So what did I do as a result? I just placed two more of these shirts on my wish list promising my wife never to eat while wearing them without also wearing a bib.Wool is now my hot weather solution from now on. Who would have thunk it?
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 8 July 2023

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt

It is apparent that the company tried to use the least amount of fabric as possible to keep down the costs, but at the same time that is the only way to be affordable. All in all, I would say the thinness is still passable, and I can feel the good quality. I would still buy again.

reviews: I knew I wanted to get some Merino Wool shirts for long travel excursions due to their ability to pack light and limit odors.  I ended up purchasing shirts from 4 different suppliers in order to find the perfect option for me.  Merino Protect was hands-down the best!  I appreciate that it doesn't have any flashy logos, it fits perfectly, and it is also softer than the others I tried (also at a better price point).  I also tested out the "odor control" by wearing it 7 days in a row and I was shocked at how it still had little to no smell (aside from my deodorant).  Just make sure to hang it up / air it out between wears.  I highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a great Merino Wool shirt.

name: Merino Protect 100% Merino Wool T Shirts for Men Odor Resistance Base Layer Lightweight Hiking Travel T-Shirt Soft Undershirt
reviews: Wore a wool tshirt from a well-known brand for 21 straight days when hiking the Kungsleden in Sweden this past August. I‚Äôll NEVER use polyester for something like that again. Wool is the way to go‚Äîlike I said, wore it every day, sweated it up, dried it overnight, maybe rinsed it a couple times, it did not stink up one bit.This T is half as expensive as that big-name-branded one. Why? This one has fewer panels, so it‚Äôs more of an ordinary fit, probably a good thing when you‚Äôve bulked up a bit since your last trip. It fits just like a size Large T meant for the outdoors should: trim, for me at 6‚Äô1‚Äù (now) 200 lbs, a size L in all US outdoor brands my whole adult life. Other than the additional panels for a slightly better/trimmer fit and the logo, I don‚Äôt see why the other T I used would cost double. The seams on this one all appear to be well done.I immediately threw this on and did a little biking to bouldering nearby. Worked up a sweat on a nice December day in NYC around 50 degrees. This T was PERFECT. Cotton would have been horrible, polyester smelly. I feel like wool somehow draws the stink away from the body and evaporates it, while polyesters only bake it in. You don‚Äôt do 21 straight days in the same polyester T shirt‚Ä¶Anyhow, this one has a perfect weight to it, about the same as a cotton T but thicker than your average polyester workout T.Bottom line: great product, I‚Äôll probably buy more.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2022

reviews: I bought this six weeks ago, wore it a few days on a trip to Europe (with a couple of sweaty days) and have worn it off and on since then, including a five-day stretch under a cotton, long-sleeve T-shirt. I'm wearing it again today by itself and if someone didn't know all I just said that person would think I had just taken it out of the packaging and put it on for the first time -- no smell (as many others have noted about Merino) and no wrinkles either! It's got an elegant look too, a cut above cotton T's, and it's soft to the touch.I imagine on another vacation trip I could probably wear this one shirt for a week or more; and maybe pack a second one just in case I might like to rinse this one and let it dry for a day. I haven't tried to wash it yet but I have to say I love it so far. If I didn't already have drawers full of cotton T's and polo shirts I'd buy a two more of these and wear them exclusively.

reviews: I normally buy 3XLT or 4X/4xlt tees.. I am 6'0", 290-300#, with a 30 inch inseam, so I'm short legged and very long torsoed. Given my girth and long body, I require a tall length otherwise my underbelly will show. NOBODY wants to see that.  This shirt fits me perfectly. I've got some pretty big  arms and the sleeves don't bind. The neck hole is just the right size, and I can reach up without exposing my gut. I am a bit older, I have grey chest hair, which a few random strands frequently poke through. That doesn't bother me. It's a work shirt. I'm not going to a celebrity gala function wearing this. I wish it did have a chest pocket. For pens, cards, earbuds, etc. But that's my only complaint. It's a good shirt. I'd buy again.

name: Gildan Men's Heavy Cotton 3/4 Raglan T-Shirt, Style G5700, 2-Pack
reviews: Decent quality. I like that it is a 2-pack and price point is very reasonable. I was skeptical with the sizing though. Being 100% cotton, I bought one size up. I like a medium fit, but I purchased size large. I put only one t-shirt in a regular wash and hot dry cycle. I have white/black. The black does bleed a little into the water, but stayed a true black after washing. The white section did not turn grey.  4 stars because they do shrink. The large turns into a medium size. As per my pictures, you can see the entire t-shirt shrunk 1 inch everywhere, body, sleeves.  I will be adding lettering so I needed to make sure sizing was washed out and that it would not shrink any further. I suppose the t-shirts may not shrink at all if they were washed in cold/warm water and hung to dry, skipping the hot dryer. I hope this helps anyone who is questioning sizing. My order was shipped without much delay, one week I believe, so I recommend the Seller and their product in my review.

reviews: Das Armour Herren HeatGear Armour Unterhemd ist schlichtweg fantastisch! Als jemand, der viel Sport treibt und auf hochwertige Sportbekleidung angewiesen ist, hat mich dieses Unterhemd in jeder Hinsicht beeindruckt.Zun√§chst einmal ist das Material absolut erstklassig. Die Atmungsaktivit√§t ist wirklich beeindruckend.Die Passform ist genau richtig. Es schmiegt sich an meinen K√∂rper an, ohne dabei einzuengen, und erm√∂glicht eine uneingeschr√§nkte Bewegungsfreiheit. Auch nach mehreren W√§schen beh√§lt es seine Form und Elastizit√§t bei.Die Haltbarkeit dieses Unterhemds ist ebenfalls bemerkenswert. Ich habe es seit Monaten im regelm√§√üigen Einsatz, und es zeigt keinerlei Abnutzungserscheinungen. Die N√§hte sind robust und die Farben verblassen nicht.Das schlichte Design des Unterhemds gef√§llt mir ebenfalls sehr gut. Es l√§sst sich problemlos mit anderen Sportbekleidungsst√ºcken kombinieren und sieht auch solo getragen stylisch aus.Zusammengefasst kann ich sagen, dass das Armour Herren HeatGear Armour Unterhemd die perfekte Kombination aus Komfort, Leistung und Langlebigkeit bietet. Egal, ob beim Training oder im Alltag, dieses Unterhemd hat sich als zuverl√§ssiger Begleiter erwiesen. Ich kann es uneingeschr√§nkt empfehlen und werde definitiv noch weitere davon kaufen.

name: Champion Mens GT22H Graphic Jersey Muscle Sleeveless Shirt
reviews: I love sleeveless shirts because it's comfortable like a t-shirt, and loose fitting like a tank top.I'm a tall guy (6'5") and I bought the large size. Here is my feedback after wearing and washing it twice:Pros:- Fast delivery- White shirt looks fantastic- Length is great for my long torso- I washed in warm and hung dry with no change in shape or color.- Makes my arms look good! HahaCons:- Fabric could be a bit softer- It's a touch too baggy for me, but then again, I have gotten used to it and it still looks really good on me being tall and slim.- It's a bit expensive.Final Thoughts:I am happy with this purchase and ended up buying the dark blue one too. I really like these shirts and I feel they are worth the money even though you are paying for the brand name. I do recommend this shirt, especially if you have a longer torso like me.Hope this helps!! Thanks.

name: Champion Mens GT22H Graphic Jersey Muscle Sleeveless Shirt
reviews: This is actually a good product, the material isn‚Äôt that thick cotton feel that champion uses as a signature material on most of there regular sleeved shirts. This is a regular standers thin cotton. Important to know that the shoulders extend outward. Further than most sleeveless tanks. I think this is just a style for this design. Some tanks don‚Äôt have an extended shoulder. This one does. The size is a bit bigger. Don‚Äôt expect a perfect fit. I wouldn‚Äôt say order a size down but expect it to feel loose and a bit baggy. This is not fitted, so all you body builders who want that snugged feel or to accent your small waist and emphasize your shoulders this isn‚Äôt the fit. It‚Äôs a bit more boxy. The solid logo on the back of the shirt gives it a very expansive casual feel. So this is gym appropriate but also going for a walk down the pier and grabbing an outdoor lunch appropriate too. This look will def compliment a chain and bracelet  accessories without you looking too try hard. Over all def worth the price point! Finally another amazon hit. Go for it! Wish they had more grey in stock tho.

name: Real Essentials 5 Pack: Men's Dry-Fit Sweat Resistant Active Athletic Performance Shorts
reviews: I recently purchased the Real Essentials 5 Pack: Men's Mesh Athletic Performance Gym Shorts with Pockets, and I am extremely satisfied with my purchase. These shorts have quickly become my go-to choice for workouts and daily activities.First and foremost, the comfort level of these shorts is unparalleled. The mesh fabric is lightweight and breathable, ensuring that I stay cool and comfortable even during intense workouts. The airy feel of the material is perfect for hot summer days and high-intensity exercises.The fit is spot on. I ordered my usual size, and the shorts fit me perfectly, providing a comfortable and non-restrictive feel. The elastic waistband offers a secure yet flexible fit, allowing for a full range of motion during exercises.The addition of pockets is a game-changer. I love having the convenience of pockets to hold my essentials, such as my phone and keys, during my gym sessions. It eliminates the need for carrying a separate bag, streamlining my workouts and making them more enjoyable.The 5-pack option is fantastic value for money. I now have a variety of colors to choose from, and each pair is equally comfortable and well-made. The quality of the construction is evident, and I can tell that these shorts are built to withstand frequent use.Moreover, these shorts are not only great for the gym but also perfect for various activities and casual wear. Whether I'm running errands, playing sports, or simply lounging at home, these shorts are my reliable choice.Cleaning and maintaining these shorts is a breeze. They wash well, and the color and shape remain intact even after multiple washes.In conclusion, the Real Essentials Men's Mesh Athletic Performance Gym Shorts with Pockets are a must-have for any active individual. Their comfort, perfect fit, and functional design make them an excellent choice for workouts and daily wear. With the added bonus of pockets and the value of the 5-pack, this purchase has exceeded my expectations in every way. I highly recommend these gym shorts to anyone in need of comfortable and versatile activewear. I am thrilled with my purchase and will definitely be buying more from Real Essentials in the future!

name: Real Essentials 5 Pack: Men's Dry-Fit Sweat Resistant Active Athletic Performance Shorts
reviews: I have two sets of these shorts, one I purchased in august of 2020 and one in august 2021. Clearly I went back to buy another set a year later so I must like them, and I do. They are priced INCREDIBLY well. At the time of the first purchase, I had just started playing sports again and needed lightweight shorts to cut and move in. These are DEFINITELY those shorts. They breath very well, they're comfortable enough that now I not only work out in them, I lounge around the house in them and go to sleep in them as well. They've held up pretty well to washing. I wash them on hot with powdered detergent and oxiclean powder and rinse them twice and then dry them on medium heat. They've probably gone through at least 100 washes thus far and I'm still wearing them. Yes, some of the seams have loose thread, yes some of them start to come off over time but they're $6 a short and none of them have unraveled to the point that there are any holes or they are unwearable, it's just something you would see when you look at the inner part of the waistband.The ONE weakness of these shorts is the pockets. I've had several that have started developing holes in the side seams of the pockets. Now it only started happening a year+ later and they've been beat up and washed many times so that's not quite so bad, but still it'll happen. I suspect this is more to do with how big and heavy phones are nowadays since it's always on my right pocket (where my phone goes) and started pretty much after I upgraded from an iphone 7 to an iphone 13 pro. But two years and 100+ aggressive washings later, only 3 out of 10 shorts have pocket holes and only one has a hole big enough that I'm scared to put my phone in the pocket.These are fantastic shorts and they could easily charge double. I plan to replace some of the original ones with a new set even now.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 9 September 2022

name: Real Essentials 5 Pack: Men's Dry-Fit Sweat Resistant Active Athletic Performance Shorts
reviews: I originally ordered a set of these before Christmas 2023, and the package I got only contained 3 of the correct shorts and 2 other cheap shorts that I can only consider "filler" that was added to the package. Was immensely disappointed in those 2 cheaper shorts (they were stained and seemed to be in a warehouse for some time as the elastic in the waistband was audible when stretched as if already dry-rotting).The correct shorts were great, they were much thinner than I expected, but very breathable and elastic. Decided to give it another shot and purchased the same item once more and actually got 5 correct branded shorts this time, same quality that I was hoping for. This time there was even a thank you card in the packaging and the packaging was different to my first order. Makes me wonder if it was a different seller the first time around.If you need some nice athletic shorts, for casual around the house wear, or exercising, these are the shorts I recommend you get.

reviews: Okay I wad surprised. This material they use for the shorts are great. The 5 pack was a 3x for me. They weren't even close what I had expected. The string to tie the shorts was short and such. That I had 1 side or the other ending up pulled into the enclosed part of the shorts where the string comes through. So it's frustrating because once this happens. We'll it's very challenging to retrieve the string.Also from the size descriptions. My size should have been perfect according to Amazon's statistics and what my purchase history has been. Got the big and tall shorts in 3x and they were loose. Had to really since uo the rope or string. It was fine.The five pack is very fairly priced. Felt that it would be awesome. Had ordered the quick dry shirts in big and tall. Now those were from the same company. Ordered 3 sets of 3 shirts packs.Will continue buying from this company. Price is very reasonable. Love that you get a wide variety of colors and packs of 3 to 5 items. The clothing is well packaged and arrives in a fair timely fashion. As a bigger heavier man. Like that they carry the variety of sizes that fit bigger people. Because it's hard finding products in the 3x and bigger sizes.Personally live black and dark blue.  So if those colors are available. Will purchase them. Recommend this company's products for everyone.Well, try them,  and enjoy. Will see you in the next review. Thanks again for your patience and time. Do not like putting any negative thought about anything. It's a trial and error world.That's the amazing thing about Amazon. If you got a problem. They are awesome in their care to their customers.Feel free to ask questions. Welcome them. Because more information and experience, helps others. To another day in paradise. Have a good one.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 16 September 2023

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: I bought a very similar pair of Wrangler shorts at Wal-Mart and the fabric was much thicker and better quality than this pair.  These feel kinda cheap; the fabric feels like it could tear fairly easily while the store bought pair, despite being used heavily for cycling for months and washed many times are now faded but the fabric and stitching are fine.Edit to my previous post ...My previous opinion was that I wouldn't buy these again but now after using them for some time, the fabric is holding out very well .... still feel very light and the mesh pockets are a little shallow.  Still a decent short.  I do hope they come out with the original pair of Wrangler shorts I bought almost two years ago.  They have a much sturdier fabric though a little heavy in really hot summer days.  Sturdiness and good pockets mean more than style etc. to me.

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: Size: I'm legit 38" if not a little more. A lot of the reviews say true to size so I ordered the 38".  If I lost a pound and jumped up and down they would have fallen to my ankles.  I guess if you like wearing a belt and like that really loose feel then stick to the 38".  I'm big shoulders no butt so I need that little bit of extra tension to keep my drawers up. I reordered the 36" and they fit great. Puts the "Flex" to a little but of test but that's what it's there for and it's comfortable. Also the smaller size looks better because the legs aren't so large. There was a huger difference between the 38" and 36".Performance: I usually graduate my clothes to "yard gear" after they have had a year or so of normal wear. I immediately put these to the test doing yard work and I will wear these from now on.  They were light which kept me cool, the waist was flexible but comfortably snug and the front pockets were deep enough to hold my phone with no issues. I push-mow a large yard and bag the clippings. My neighbors will appreciate that now when I bend over to remove the bagger they won't be confused that a plumber is doing my yardwork. Highly recommend these and also recommend the Flex version of the Wrangler jeans that are sized in a similar fashion.  I have bought another pair and will likely buy a few more. I would even work out at the gym in these when that time comes... maybe having these will motivate me to get there.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 7 April 2021

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: I am able to wear shorts to work and I saw these and figured to give them a try.  First I must say, as a guy I am used to the demin or thick cotton feel for pants/shorts, these are not that feel. These are a stretchy material. When wearing them they are very comfortable and when you sit, as a guy the material is stretchy so you can sit down comfortably without issues. They look like regular shorts, I feel the waistband is a little wider but not in a bad way. I have washed this pair 3x now, they wash well, no fading or coming apart as I read in one review but they do look wrinkly, not bad enough to have to iron them, besides when you put them on the wrinkles seem to go away, I think its the stretchy material that makes them look that way. I paid $27 for this paid off shorts and it's about as hight as I would want to pay. I do need to mention that I did order a second pair, black as these are more of an olive color.  I hope this review helps.

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: I am glad I bought these shorts. For the sake of comfort I bought them one size larger than what I usually buy, and they fit perfectly. The zippered pockets are just big enough for a Samsung Galaxy A53 phone, with some minor difficulty in closing and opening the zipper once the phone is in the pocket. The only disappointment is that the front button is not a button at all, but a snap-on  as shown in the picture. My experience with snaps is that they have broken off after some use, so I will be careful using this one. I was pleasantly surprised by the extra pocket inside the left front pocket. All of the front pockets are deep enough to securely hold your keys and wallet. Edited to say: I bought these at a different size five months later. The material in the first pair I bought looks quite worn, from use and washings, compared to the newer pair.

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: I was looking for shorts that were lightweight, wrinkle resistant, and flexible for a trip to Europe. I was also looking for extra pockets, but I don't like cargo pants with flaps or buttons. Wrangler had the perfect answer. These shorts fit great, and the material (mostly nylon) is lightweight and flexible. They come with two zipper pockets that are perfect for traveling or day-to-day. They are cut a bit narrow in the leg, which is fine for me (5'10", 170lb.) I bought granite (dark gray) and sagebrush (grayish green). I tried the bronze but didn't like the color. I wish they came in a lighter shade, like khaki or beige.

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: 4 or 5 years ago when the ATG line came out I absolutely loved the shorts and pants. The wear and tear has me looking at re-uping the whole wardrobe. I ordered my first pair of shorts and was happy opening. 1st noticed they changed from a button to a snap fastener, meh, okay, prefer button. 2nd notice was a bigger deal, these shorts are two inches longer inseam length than the previous line. At 5'9" I liked that the old shorts were just above the knee. Any shorts that hang below the knee are a grotesque late 90's jnko white trash look. 3rd, with the extra length, these new line shorts sit higher on the waist. It feels like the belt needs to sit an inch below the navel rather on the hips like the old line.PROS: Love the elastic fabric, light weight, great form fit for muscular legs, most comfortable shorts I've ever owned.CONS: Downgrade from previous years, longer, sits higher, snap fastener, binding after washing, stitching has never been top quality.

reviews: Did a bunch of looking for value cargo shorts with zippers. Ordered from Pudilla, and Jessie after narrowing the field, and the wranglers were the best. The material seems sturdy enough for good use, but is super flexable, breathes, and is very comfortable to wear. They also handle getting wet well, and the pockets are well laid out. The belt loops are big, and no pockets are stupidly small.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 15 July 2023

name: Wrangler Mens Performance Comfort Flex Waist Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: First, the description of these cargo shorts on Amazon is totally inadequate. The absolutely most important feature of these shorts that is not evident on the Amazon web site is that they truly have STRETCH. I an a waist 33 and I ordered a 32. They fit perfectly since the waist and the pants have great stretch. They would also fit perfectly for someone with a 32 inch waist. Too many pants on the internet are described as having a stretch feature, but in fact do not. Secondly, there is not description of the pockets. These shorts have 7 pockets, but you would not know it from the website. Zippers are on the two side cargo pockets so you can secure your phone and wallet in these pockets if you will be exercising. The other pockets are deep, as is the "watch" pocket. Great fabric. I reordered another pair after wearing the first pair. Can't address durability, but they are made much better than my other cargo shorts. Great buy!!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 18 June 2022

reviews: Excellent brand and quality. I‚Äôve purchased a pair directly from dickies previously that fit perfectly. The problem is as has been 3 times now that when I‚Äôve purchased size 40 inch shorts from overseas they have sent me 36 inch. Sent back first pair as they paid for postage. I received a full refund. I‚Äôm left with the second pair of carpenter denim shorts as it would cost me almost the price I paid for the shorts in postage back to the USA. Also I have a month to drop off this pair at a parcel return which is hard as the closest is 4-5 hours drive away. Bit of a scam really if you‚Äôre not from a major city that has a return facility. Be warned if you‚Äôre looking for larger sizes. I won‚Äôt be buying off here .

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: These are great semi-compression shorts.  Why do I say "semi-compression" you ask?  Well, real compression shorts are expensive, around $30 and up per pair.  Too pricey to have enough to wear daily.I have dysautonomia from Covid, and it really has turned my life upside down.  Blood pressure and flow to limbs is affected.  My doctor suggested I wear compression socks and underwear to help with blood flow issues.I purchased 3 different brands to see which were the best.  I bought these (Zengvee), Telaleo, and Niksa, all from Amazon.  The Zengvee are definitely my favorite. While all three are the same length (see picture), the other 2 brands were more high-waisted than the Zengvee, making the Zengvee effectively longer on my legs.  The other 2 brands tend to have a waistband that rolls.  The Zengvee waistband didn't roll, and seem to be a bit thicker than the other 2 brands.  After several months of wearing them, the Zengvee are the definite winner.  They are comfortably snug as expected without being uncomfortable.One side note; when I bought them, all 3 brands claimed to be 85% polyester and 15% spandex.  Since I need compression to regulate my blood pressure, I assumed more spandex would equal more compression.  Unfortunately, of the 3 brands I bought, only the Telaleo were actually 15% spandex, even though all 3 brands are advertised as 15% spandex.  I don't notice a difference in the actual compression while wearing them, but was annoyed at the deceptive marketing claims.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym

name: Champion Men's Long Mesh
reviews: Champion Men's Mesh Gym Shorts are a fantastic addition to any active individual's wardrobe. These shorts perfectly balance comfort and functionality, making them an essential choice for workouts and casual wear alike.The lightweight mesh material not only ensures optimal breathability but also allows for a full range of motion during exercise. Whether you're hitting the gym, going for a run, or playing sports, these shorts keep you cool and comfortable.The elastic waistband provides a secure fit without feeling restrictive, and the adjustable drawstring adds a customizable element to the fit. The minimalist design is versatile, making them ideal for pairing with various workout tops or casual shirts.What truly sets these shorts apart is Champion's commitment to quality. The durable stitching and attention to detail guarantee that they'll withstand regular use and countless washes while maintaining their shape and color.Whether you're a fitness enthusiast or simply enjoy comfortable clothing, Champion Men's Mesh Gym Shorts deliver on every front. Their combination of style, functionality, and durability makes them a reliable choice for all your athletic and leisure activities. Say goodbye to discomfort and hello to a new level of comfort and confidence with these remarkable shorts.

name: Champion Men's Long Mesh
reviews: Five-star review, but let me get some of the downsides out of the way for those who might consider these downsides:1) They are mesh gym shorts. Because of that, they do have a little bit of a see-through effect. So don't be surprised if you buy the white ones and you go out wearing them and people can tell what color underwear you're wearing. (Protip: Wear underwear.)2) I've bought these in multiple colors. They are all true-to-size, excepting that the default "athletic gray" one seems to fit a little more snugly. (It also doesn't have the little split on the side of the leg, which makes me wonder if I was delivered the wrong thing on that particular purchase; who knows?) So caveat emptor on the athletic-gray color. But the rest fit great.3) A couple of the colors on these may not look exactly like they do on your computer or phone screen, but for my taste they are even better. The Swiss Blue looks like a nice cheery blue without looking faded. The Team Gold looks like a rich golden color without being either faded or bright as a disco ball.That said:These are great. They are comfy. They are great for working out. They are great for lazing around eating potato chips on the couch. And they are great for doing Zoom calls so you can go casual out of sight while you're wearing a shirt and tie up top.I'm the kind of guy who, when I'm at home, likes to wear clothes that I don't have to think about and say to myself, "Oh, yeah, I'm wearing clothes." These pretty much hit the mark on that. These are now long-term fixtures of my stay-at-home wardrobe.FYI: The inseam on these goes just past my knees.For care: Just make sure you don't put these in the dryer too long or too hot. Consider putting them in the dryer on low, and then if they're still a little damp, hanging them to air dry the rest of the way.

reviews: I have been using amazon consistently for 5 years and this is my first time writing a review due to these shorts. I have been in the market for new compression shorts for years as i've been stuck with the ones i've had since high school (gross I know) but i've been super picky and fellas you know what I mean, you have to be. I've gone through/returned so many and different brands as well because they were too small/too big/too loose/too tight/uncomfortable/etc. you name it. You need high quality compression shorts so you're not constantly adjusting yourself in the gym/on a run/etc. These shorts are super high quality, perfect amount of stretch on the waist line as well as the area protecting the goods, perfect amount of compression without being uncomfortable. These shorts are absolutely perfect and i'm super happy to finally be able to throw away my torn-to-shreds old pairs. (I am 6'4 240lbs)

I use these for kickboxing/ju-jitus/running , the side-pocket for a phone seems a bit superfluous.  Usually I'm a size L, but if you have large legs go a size up to XL, the waistband has good elasticity, won't slip and doesn't 'pinch'.  Overall, 10/10 for quality, performance and value. Highly recommended.

name: Wrangler
reviews: This cargo shorts is the best one I bought so far compared to all other brands. It is lightweight and soft compared to other brands that feels heavy when worn. The additional pockets are so great to have that you can use and forget carrying a small bag in some occasions. The delivery was swift and courier was courteous enough to let me know it's delivered. Overall I am satisfied and thank you seller for the best service! I recommend this to all cargo short fanatics out there!

I did send one pair back to be replaced becasue the zipper stuck, I certainly don't think that's becasue of lack of quality, it some times happens, but these shorts are built very well but aren't too thick and heavy. I will definitely buy another pair as they represent solid value for the purchasing dollar.

name: Wrangler
reviews: I've always had Wrangler products in the past (mostly jeans) but I've come across a few of their cargo shorts.  I wasn't sure what to expect with this pair of pants as I've had bad experiences in the past with older companies going "cheap" and sacrificing quality for the sake of better margins (i.e. Levi's).This pair of pants definitely exceeded my expectations in terms of quality, comfort and style!  It fit very snug and the premium twill is worth the extra $ and the pricing is still competitive enough to consider this a bargain.  I was expecting a bit more "padding" in terms of the material used as it is a bit thinner compared to previous pants I've worn from Wrangler.  It doesn't seem like it will wear out quickly so maybe the thinner material was done on purpose to help with comfort in the heat.  I've owned these for about 3 years now and they are still going strong!  Finally made the time to review these.  Will consider buying more of these in the future!

name: Lee Men's Dungarees New Belted Wyoming Cargo Short
reviews: I get all husbands wardrobe from Amazon & this first pair of shorts I've ever ordered that was huge in size. Not sure how happen but we looked at size & it was 40 in waist. Always ordered 38's and all fit husband perfect. How we ended up with these big shorts we dont know. Husband didn't try on as soon as we got. We both purchased a new summer wardrobe. Which is lots of new shorts, shirts, tanks & blouses. Amazon I use alot for us & rarely we ever now come across not something that don't fit. Hung up & husband only picks shorts a couple times a week. Works long hours & 6 days a week. Time he decides to put these on, he asks me, what in world did I get. Really huge in size. More like a 44 because I say what about belt & use for home comfy. I came & looked at them. No way only word Huge! So I told him to late to return & the cost in shipping. Plus chances are not get size correct in this brand. So we donated to our charity

name: Lee Men's Dungarees New Belted Wyoming Cargo Short
reviews: These shorts feel super soft and great against the skin. I like the look of them too. My complaints are that these are cut a little big so I had to return the first order and then order a size smaller. They also don't stay up on your waist since the fabric is so soft and the belt that comes with them doesn't really stay tight but slowly start to slip lose when you move around, especially if you have something heavier in your pockets like my Note 10+ phone which has some heft. I find myself pulling up the pants back to my waist and pulling the belt snug several times a day when running errands or working outside. It would be awesome if they added a non-slip waist band to these like my golf shorts have on the inside of the waist band. Also if the included belt had more grip texture so it would keep from slipping loose when you move around.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Edit 29th Apr 18. Worn about 20 times since purchase and now ripped at stitching at rear seam whilst squatting. This is not at the stretch panel, shame they didnt use a bit of the stretch panel at the rear seam.Over all still good shorts but just cant handle heavy squatting. I am tempted to try a larger size see if the extra room will perform better.Very strong shorts with stretch material in backside area which is good for squatting, as they don‚Äôt rip like most do under heavy load. They have a good rise as well which is rare in today‚Äôs climate of shorts hanging half way down your backside. However they are totally let down when it comes to leg room. I purchased a size up from what I needed as recommended in another review and they are barley loose on my thighs. After squatting in them I have been left with red marks and bruising where the material has been so tight around my thighs. I thought rugby shorts would be good due to the leg size of the players, clearly not in this case. If you have larger thighs (mine are only 29 inches, so I don‚Äôt consider them large at all) and plan on doing gym work I would avoid these. Such a shame as could have been perfect with 1-2 more inch of thigh room.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: These are extremely durable, comfortable shorts. I wear these primarily for no-gi Brazilian jiu-jitsu (BJJ) and am very pleased with their performance overall. BJJ-oriented brands commonly offer lower quality shorts at nearly double the price.There are just a couple of things I would love to see improved:- The black shorts appear to be very dark blue. If you wear them with anything else that's actually black, the contrast can be pretty obvious.- The "legs" could be slightly stretchier to enable greater mobility. There is an elastic panel in the crotch area, and the leg openings are generously sized, but additional elastic panels on the fronts/sides of the legs would be nice.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: I love these shorts. Although a rugby player, I actually bought them for the gym. Having quite big thighs and butt, I struggle with most training pants, particularly at the bottom of the squat. I have ripped several trousers this way and the result with some shorts is that they stick on the thighs and pull the waistband down, so I end up partially mooning the rest of the gym while in the squat rack!The added thick lycra/ stretch areas around the groin and sides of the thighs mean these babies stay right where you put the on and no risk of exploding out of them. Tough and durable as well and the material doesn't fade when washed. So the colour looks crisp still after several washes.

reviews: This review is for Nautica Men's Classic Fit Flat Front Stretch Solid Chino 8.5" Deck Shorts.  I have them in both Khaki and Blue Indigo.  The colors look better than what is show in the listings, especially the blue indigo.  The material is very nice and comfortable.  The slight stretch adds to the fit and comfort.  These are also true to size.  The length ends just at the top of my knee cap.  The front pockets aren't very deep or shallow.  I was a little concerned that my wallet or large phone would drop out of the front pockets, but I have not had any issues.  Overall, these shorts are excellent, and I am very happy with them.

name: Nautica Men's Classic Fit Flat Front Stretch Solid Chino Deck Short
reviews: During summer I live in these.  So far I have bought 4 of these shorts and all 4 are great.  The length is perfect, not too long and not too short, just above the knees.  The crotch area is very comfortable, when you sit your friends will not get crushed.  Pockets are nice and deep, I can fit my iPhone 13 Max comfortably and without having to constantly adjust and it doesn't leave a big imprint, even when i sit down the phone is not in the way.  I am 5'9" and 180 Lbs athletic build and waist 35 fits me very well.  The cloth and workmanship is also good.  My plan is to eventually buy all the colors.  So the fit, the style, the cloth, the tailoring all combine to give you a relaxed summery shorts.  if you are looking for skinny fit tight shorts then don't get these.  Hope that was helpful.

name: Volcom
reviews: Right off the bat, let's talk color. I was looking at the burnt sienna for a while but I was worried that they were going to be too orange and/or too bright. They aren't. The product photo is pretty close to what you get. In bright light like in the photo of me wearing them, they do appear lighter but it's not obnoxious.I would refer to these more as burgundy than orange but color perception can be variable across people.I am not the kind of person who wears bright colored shorts that stand out. My other shorts are tan, light grey, dark gray, khaki... These burnt sienna shorts are on the edge of my comfort zone but I really like them!As for the shorts themselves, I love them. I already have several other pairs of Volcom shorts. They are casual but look polished. The length falls at my knee (I'm 6 feet tall). They have a slightly slim cut so they aren't baggy. Deep front pockets. Normal back pockets, no button closure.(they are wrinkly on me because I put them on straight out of the bag)

name: Lee Mens 21861 Extreme Motion Swope Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: The comfort level of these shorts is outstanding. The fabric has just the right amount of stretch, allowing for unrestricted movement during any physical activity. Whether I'm hiking, cycling, or simply lounging around, the shorts never feel restrictive or uncomfortable. The waistband is adjustable and features a flex waist for a customizable fit, adding to the overall comfort factor.In terms of durability, the Lee Men's Extreme Motion Swope Cargo Shorts certainly impressed me. I have worn them on multiple occasions, and they have held up remarkably well. The construction feels solid, and the stitching is strong, ensuring that these shorts will withstand the test of time. Even after frequent use and washing, I have not noticed any signs of wear or tear.The cargo pockets are another notable feature of these shorts. They provide ample storage space for essentials like keys, a phone, or a small wallet. The pockets are deep enough to securely hold items, and the Velcro closures ensure that nothing falls out during physical activities or when you're on the move.The only reason I deducted one star from the rating is that, while the shorts are durable overall, the color tends to fade slightly after repeated washes. However, this is a minor drawback and doesn't significantly impact the functionality or overall appeal of the shorts.

name: Lee Mens 21861 Extreme Motion Swope Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: I‚Äôm a 46 year old suburban dad who wears cargo shorts, New Balance shoes and dad hats. I know who I am, and am comfortable with that. There was a period when dads in cargo shorts was a running joke. But I‚Äôll take it; I‚Äôm not giving up my cargo shorts for anything.These shorts are the very best of the best when it comes to practical utility. Affordable (often on sale), stretchy in the waist for those days I eat a big sandwich or two, and deep pockets for storing all kinds of stuff. They‚Äôre even a little trim. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù/170-175 lb with a 34 waist and I get these in a 33 for a nice comfy fit. Basically a man-purse you can wear.If someone tells me my shorts are anything less than awesome, I‚Äôll tell ‚Äòem I‚Äôd care about their opinion but I‚Äôm too busy stashing snacks in my awesome pockets. Peace.

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: I first ordered size 36, the size I wear in my Carhartt shorts, but the size was much too larger. I returned them and ordered the shorts in a size 34, but these were too big. I returned them for a refund. I liked the features of the UnionBay brand, so I ordered them in a size 32, they fit perfect! Although, I was surprised that they seamed to be made of o heavier cloth material and the small pocket, on each leg, did not have a flap over the pocket. I used the small pocket for small items, like nail clippers, small Leatherman, etc.. The very first day I wore one of the pairs, I lost my favorite nail clippers. A real bummer. Lesson learned: Don't put anything anything in the small pockets because you have a very good chance of loosing whatever you put in them. Other than that, I love the quality of all the different pairs I ordered.

reviews: Pro's  They use Velcro instead of buttons on the pocket flaps, it makes it so much easier to open. Buttons make the flaps wrinkle when not buttoned up. Well stitched, The front pockets are deep, so things won't fall out, well worth the money to me. Con's would be that they are 11 inch inseam, and is over the top part of my knee cap. I prefer a 9 inch inseam. Last time I bought cargo shorts was 15 years ago, and the material is thinner then my old ones. The small front pocket on the left side, made for a key fob doesn't have a Velcro flap, and you could possibly lose your key fob if it were to fall out. The belt looks ok, but I use my own belt. I did like these so much, that I decided to buy more.

reviews: Great quality and a nice fit. This is my second pair of these shorts and I think that is the best recommendation you can give. These fit well and are nicely finished with velcro on the pockets, not annoying snaps. The pocket flaps are designed in such a way as to not fold over in the wash and stay that way for the life of the garment. Material weight is medium and just right for summer or warmer climates. A casual but good looking pair of shorts. I order these in the same size as my other pants and shorts.

From his experience, I took it easy on any lifting and have to hike up the legs just to bend over or lift anything.Full disclosure: I have full-figured quads/butt from a lot of weight lifting, but the friend who tore his pants is a slim guy.

reviews: Hangs just above the knee. The sizing is on point, but generous. 11" inseam is great. Side pocket depth is good, flaps adequate. I like the velcro closures on the pocket flaps. I dont use the rear pockets. No current problem with my stitching, after 1 wash. Fabbed in Shri Lanka. Fabric is decent thickness and soft. Minimal number of belt loops. I like the color (Android), it looks like the pic. 1 point off for the zipper, which the up/down movement is not smooth, concern the this may limit the life of the shorts. Also the belt is a waste of material. Should can the belt and put that savings into a better, smoother operating zipper, then I'd give these shorts a 5! But from a price standpoint, I would recommend.

But they‚Äôre still very comfortable and an exceptional value. We got these mostly for ‚Äúdays off‚Äù and relaxing at home and not to be too worried if the cats snag the fabric on them. A little disappointed with the print patterns on these shorts, I worry that it‚Äôll crack or seriously degrade with frequent wear and washing. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5, we got the large size and they‚Äôre a bit long on me, just below the knee so I tend to wear mine up a bit higher. My husband is 5‚Äô9 and the large fits him well and falls just above the knee. There is an adjustment band inside these in case you prefer to size up. name: Liberty Imports Pack of 5 Men's Athletic Basketball Shorts Mesh Quick Dry Activewear with Pockets
reviews: For a shade under $35 (on sale), honestly I wasn't expecting much. With that said, I'm pleasantly surprised! I've tried a number of cheaper brand shorts from Amazon over the years, and these are the perfect balance of fit, price, and weight without being see through. Are they the quality of a pair of $50 shorts from Nike? Well, no, but you're getting 5 pair for less than one of those, and I'd say the quality is 85-90% of the way there.The main problem I tend to have with cheap shorts is the fit. More often than not, they end up being too tight in the groin area, which makes them sit awkwardly on your thighs/butt. Not these though, they hang just right, and look just how they should. Going to order another set just because of how pleased I am!If you're looking for quality cheap shorts, these are for you!

name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: I prefer a basic, no-frills, inexpensive workout short for my exercise activities (about 1-1.5 hours per day, 3-4 times per week). After years of buying Champion brand, I decided to give the Russell product a try based on positive reviews. I found these to be a good value. What I like most about them is the fit, which is a bit looser and longer than the Champion model.  At 5'8", 165 lbs with a 33 waist, medium is just perfect for me. The material is smooth and breathes well. The waist is snug enough for the shorts to stay put, but not too tight to be comfortable. I like the pockets, which I use to hold my little iPod shuffle during my workouts. Overall a solid product and sufficient for my purposes.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: I don't usually review items promptly but the customer service is something to talk about.  I ordered a size L and they sent me an M.  The paper tag said L but the actual tag on the shorts said M so the mix-up was understandable.  I ordered a size L a second time so they would arrive on time for my boyfriend's birthday and emailed amazon about returning the size M.  I heard back right away from the seller and was told that my money will be refunded and that I do not have to go through the hassle of returning the shorts.The new shorts that were correctly labeled size L on both tags came in today and they are great.  The Texas Orange is a beautiful burnt copper color and I couldn't be happier about it.  The shorts themselves are long which is great because my boyfriend is 6ft 4 and has trouble with basketball shorts being too short sometimes, but these will look great on him.  The pockets are a big plus because he likes to have a place to put his keys and phone when he goes out.  The elastic on the shorts is really strong but very stretchy meaning that they will be comfortable but won't fall down.  What I loved the most about the shorts is how thin the material is.  My boyfriend gets very sweaty and always complains about shorts being 'too hot' but these are so airy and light that I think he will love them.  I will be ordering in more colors after I get his take on these shorts.

reviews: These shorts were definitely worth the buy. A lot better than I had expected, and here's why:-the shorts a very comfy. The perforations are big enough to provide more than enough breathing room and ventilation, but not so big that the shorts are super-see through.-the material not only feels good but looks good. I ordered the green colorway and it looks really nice. I'm even planning on making another order, that is if I decide whether or not these are better quality than Champion branded shorts.-it has pockets which is a must for me when it comes to shorts I plan to use on a consistent basis to be able to hold my keys and wallet.-the drawstring is also strong enough so that if I were to have my phone, keys and wallet in my pockets, the shorts won't drop.All in all, these shorts are really nice, both for home use and outdoor use for walking and sports alike.If I were able to help you make a purchase, or help you prevent from making one you'd regret.
