name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: (I did not receive any compensation, discount or free products for my review. I don't work for this company. This is just flat honesty.)  The first thing I can say is I am pleasantly surprised that shorts of this quality come at such a low price point. That is a big selling point here. I could buy Nike, but why when I can get the same thing for $11-$12 bucks? That seems like a waste of money. Mind you, I'm not a, "Keep up with the Jones' kind of guy.)  So, unless you just have to have a "brand," buy 3 or 4 pair of these instead.  **After having having several pair of these shorts for over a month I came back to edit my review from a 4 star rating to a 5. I suppose since I've already ordered several additional pair I really like them. I wear them around the house every day. They are extremely comfortable - not only for relaxing but for yard work, painting, etc. In fact, I like these shorts so much that I hate it when I don't have a pair clean, so like I said, "I ordered more!"  I live in central hell, where the summer climate is so hot that the last thing you want to do is work outside or in a hot garage. Yet, the mesh fabric accomplishes its job -matching the description. The mesh allows heat to escape and maintain a cool feeling without trapping in sweat. (Whomever created the fabric should be rich by now.) When beckoned I come in from the garage, sit down at the dinner table and the shorts are throughly dry.  *The shorts launder easily and hold up well in hot water and a hot dryer. No special steps required. I don't like athletic shorts that you can't just toss in the dryer. Some expensive shorts state, "Wash only. Hang to dry." That's too much work! Draw string is one piece with a knot below, so you don't have to worry about loosing the string in the washer and then trying to find it and put it back in. (I hate that.)  Exercising: I've worked out for 35 years, and I can tell you these are some of the coolest and most comfortable shorts I've ever worn. The pockets are the perfect depth. There is plenty of room to fit my keys and iphone 6-plus. Unlike some shorts, whatever is in my pocket's stays there. It does not fall out. (The manufacturer gets some points there.) I don't have to worry about loosing my keys, an adventure I'd rather skip. (Of course, be logical.) I wouldn't recommend engaging in heavy athletic activities with expensive items in your pocket, yet I can wear the shorts to make a quick trip to the store without my phone falling out.  Importantly, there is plenty of room in the circumference of the legs to allow for men with very muscular thighs. The fabric stretches a bit, but will not remain stretched out. If you have huge thighs you might consider ordering a size larger than normal unless you fancy very tight shorts? I've never had that issue. There is ample room in the crotch for any man; however, be aware that you will not get any athletic support from the shorts. So, depending you your preference and need you may wish to wear protection underneath.  Lastly, the shorts are a bit longer than I expected. The waist to knee measures 19" and the crotch to bottom of shorts is 13". I am 6'3", and the bottom meets the top of my knee.  That is a thorough review of the shorts. I hope it helps you make an educated decision.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 12 May 2016

name: Under Armour UA Tech Short, Mens, Bottoms, Shorts, 10 in
reviews: As an avid golfer, I recently added the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Shorts to my golfing gear collection, and they have exceeded my expectations in every way!First and foremost, the comfort level of these shorts is unmatched. The fabric is incredibly soft and lightweight, providing a perfect balance of flexibility and breathability during those hot summer rounds on the golf course. I no longer feel restricted in my movements, allowing me to focus solely on my swing and performance.The moisture-wicking technology is a game-changer! Even during the hottest and most intense rounds, these shorts keep me dry and cool, eliminating any discomfort caused by sweat. It's impressive how quickly they dry, ensuring I stay comfortable throughout the game.The fit is spot on! With the elastic waistband and adjustable drawstring, I can easily customize the fit to my liking, ensuring a snug and comfortable feel without worrying about them slipping during my swings.Moreover, the design of these shorts is both sleek and sporty, making me look and feel like a professional golfer on the course. The variety of colors available is a nice touch, allowing me to mix and match with my golf shirts.Durability is another standout feature of the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Shorts. After numerous washes and rounds of golf, they still look and feel brand new, with no signs of wear and tear.Whether it's a casual weekend round with friends or a competitive tournament, these shorts have become my go-to choice. I even wear them for other outdoor activities and everyday wear because of their versatile and comfortable nature.In conclusion, the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Shorts have truly elevated my golfing experience. The combination of comfort, performance, and durability is unparalleled, making them an essential part of my golfing gear. If you're a golfer looking for high-quality shorts that excel in every aspect, don't hesitate to grab a pair of these fantastic shorts‚Äîyou won't be disappointed! ‚õ≥Ô∏èüèåÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

name: LEE Men's Carpenter Jean Short
reviews: Whether its a pair of jeans or shorts, I prefer Lee brand. Why? Not only do they fit perfectly and are very comfortable, but they have those little pockets on the side of the right leg that perfectly holds a cell phone or a pair of glasses in the case. At 40 my eyes kind of went down hll, so I always have my reading glasses with me. I don't like carrying them in my ants pocket, because the wire frames get all bent up. If I have a shirt pocket, I'll end up losing my glasses because they always want to fall out. So the easy solution is to wear Lee Carpenter jeans and shorts. If you carry your phone or glasses around all of the time, try a pair of these on for size. You won't lose your phone or your glasses with these on and they fit and look great too! What more can you ask for?Edit: I really wanted to give these shorts a Five Star Rating, but when they arrived, one of the belt loops had been poorly sewn and because I use the belt loops to hang my car keys with garage door opener from, that is a big issue with me. If I had purchased these from a local store, I would have noticed the bad sewn belt loop and put them back to select a different pair. This defect is the fault of Amazon, not the quality of the shorts themselves. I still love the fit and usual finish of these shorts and their pants.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 18 December 2013

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: I've been buying Large size shorts and other pants for 30 years. The unstretched dimensions are ok, but the elastic stretches far too easily and almost doubles in size! I'm not that kind of build, so while they seem great quality for the price, you need to be quite large for these shorts not to slip down...as for using the pockets...this could be quite embarrassing with a mobile phone and or wallet! The drawstring is interesting - it is a loop, and may need to be cut to be able to be tied in a bow. I'd probably be ok with the next size down but don't get the option to exchange online so I returned these shorts for a refund.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: These shorts have convinced me not to buy any more items from an American dealer. I bought a large size, which I am normally in Australia and I am practically swimming in these shorts. The length comes WELL below the knee and I look like such a geek in them.I suspect I should have gone a small size. Which to me is absurd. American men must be giants.The fabric is alright; not great. The pockets are not sewn into place and kinda flop around which is annoying.I think I'm going to use them as pyjama pants tbh.

date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 17 January 2024

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: These shorts are great for lounging around the house, and for wearing to bed, especially if you don't like sleeping in long sweats/pajamas.I don't recommend these for the gym or really any outdoor activity due to the style and thin-fabric: They're really just too casual of a style for more than lounging. That's just my opinion, of course, so if you're the type of dude to wear old, ratty, grey sweats, or worn-out t-shirts with the sleeves personally cut-off, out in public -by all means, knock yourself out!I've had several pairs of these over the last decade, and they're my go-to sleep-shorts. All of my original purchases were at Sports Authority, then 2 from Amazon within the last year.Although they are pretty lightweight and soft, the shorts are comparatively quite durable, as none of mine have ever worn through or come apart -- I just seem to lose a pair every couple of years, on a trip or at a hotel stay, then re-purchase.  The current shorts' material is approximately the same as my originals, but the stitching around the waistband is much less detailed, and frankly looks a bit sloppy.  The older shorts had very detailed, sturdy, and useful stitching around the waist and drawstring-area -I've attached some pics for comparison.  My recent purchase had long strands of excess thread dangling from some of the stitching.  I had to trim all of this off, in lieu of better quality control at the factory or by the distributor.The inner tag is still annoyingly sewn into the vertical seam right at the top of your tailbone (butt-crack, to be crass), so I just carefully cut it out before the first laundering.I'm not a fan of logos -- but for information's sake, the logo used to be embroidered onto the leg and now it's simply silkscreened-on.The fit is "as-expected".I'm not super-happy with the waistband change or the loose thread everywhere, but I got my recent pair for half-off during prime-day, so -Score!
